net.sergetk.mobile.lcdui
Class MultiText

java.lang.Object
  net.sergetk.mobile.lcdui.MultiText

public class MultiText
extends java.lang.Object

Text formatting and drawing utility.

This code is a part of the Mobile Fonts Project (http://sourceforge.net/projects/mobilefonts)

Author:
Sergey Tkachev http://sergetk.net

globalColor

public int globalColor
If text color is default, it will be rendered in globalColor. This method allows to change text color without re-formatting.

Constructor Detail

MultiText

public MultiText(java.lang.Object font,
                 java.lang.String text,
                 javax.microedition.lcdui.Image image)
Creates a new instance of MultiText object.

Parameters:
font - text font, must be an instance of Font or BitmapFont
text - the text
image - the image, can be null if you don't need it
Method Detail

setWidth

public void setWidth(int width)
Sets the width and formats the text.

Parameters:
width - the width in pixels

getHeight

public int getHeight()
Gets the height of the formatted text. You must call this method only after text had been formatted (by calling format() of setWidth()).

Returns:
height in pixels

format

public void format()
Formats the text. Call this method if you changed any parameters such as text, alignment or margins. Note that setWidth() calls this method itself.

draw

public void draw(javax.microedition.lcdui.Graphics g,
                 int x,
                 int y)
Draws the text.

Parameters:
g - the graphics context
x - the x position
y - the y position

draw

public void draw(javax.microedition.lcdui.Graphics g,
                 int x,
                 int y,
                 int start,
                 int end)
Draws the text in the specified range of lines.

Parameters:
g - the graphics context
x - the x position
y - the y position
start - the start line to be drawn
end - the end line to be drawn

toLowerCase

public static char toLowerCase(char c)
Converts a character to lower case. Many mobile devices have no full implementation of toLowerCase() method. They aren't support national alphabets. Following method can convert cyrillic strings to lower case. You can extend it to another alphabets.

Parameters:
c - source character
Returns:
character in lower case

toLowerCase

public static java.lang.String toLowerCase(java.lang.String s)
Converts a string to lower case. Many mobile devices have no full implementation of toLowerCase() method. They aren't support national alphabets. Following method can convert cyrillic strings to lower case. You can extend it to another alphabets.

Parameters:
s - the source string
Returns:
the string in lower case
